Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech and does not balance it.
It represents coercion and manipulation by those in power.
The bill undermines democratic society by policing differing opinions.
It positions the government as the sole arbiter of truth, which is dangerous.
The bill could lead to invasive monitoring and record-keeping of individuals.
Notable Quotes: This bill crosses a significant line when it comes to freedom of speech and does not ‘balance’ it.
It implicitly states that any view which contradicts the narrative or opinion of the government is incorrect and should be policed.
Having a government body determine what is termed ‘misinformation’ and ‘disinformation’ is not only unwarranted but completely dangerous.
